page.title: 03Local History:Saxons,Railway
page.content: The Fareham to Alton single track line was cut in 1900.{Saxon}graves found. Line closed 1962,now a well_walked footpath.Bench in village square commemorates meeting of{Allied leaders planning{D_day}1944.In 1973 bones found by archaeologist;41 graves excavated 1974.From late 5th century for perhaps 150yrs about 200 people were buried.In 1984 the skeleton of a Saxon girl was brought to School with a shield boss,spear,beads,buckles etc The class went "into the past" in Winchester Cathedral as part of Saxon festival.Site now overgrown,finds at Hampshire County Museum Winchester Report _ Hampshire Field Club and Archaeological Soc.35 '79 93_182 Latest village history "Droxford in the Meon Valley" by Kenneth Ward
